Initial Period: Initial period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This value is used as the denominator when calculating the ratios of updates during VT compensation.

register.description: DATX8 n Master Delay Line Register 1

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
MDL Delay: Delay select for the LCDL for the Master Delay Line.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQ write path latency pipeline: Write data is pipelined by (WLSL + WDQSL). Total write data pipeline is: [Write leveling system latency] + WDQSL/2 DRAM clock periods This value is adjusted by LPDDR4 tDQS2DQ training and write eye centering. Any update in DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] will update this field after 20 DDRSS_PHY_CTL_CLK clock cycles. Reading this field shows the number of pipelines (UI delays) written into DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] field. Make sure content of this register field is not overwritten by the software.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Write Leveling System Latency: Used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. This field is for the byte when in x8 mode Valid values:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 0x00 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). Valid values are 0 to 18 and each increment adds a half SDRAM CK period.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQS Gate Training Error: Indicates if set that there is an error in DQS gate training of the byte in x8 mode One bit for each of the up to 16 ranks.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Read Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is an error in read leveling training of the byte in x8 mode One bit for each of the up to 16 ranks.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Write Latency Adjustment “DQS off on some DQ lines” warning. One bit per rank indicates that, for that rank, the WLA algorithm found some DQ lines where the read data sequence did not match the expected comparison signatures. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Write Latency Adjustment error: Indicates, for each of the system ranks, that an error occurred in the WLA algorithm. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Write Leveling DQ Status: Captures the write leveling DQ status from the DRAM during software write leveling.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Read DQS gating Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
DATX8 PLL Lock: Indicates, if set, that DATX8 PLL has locked. This is a direct status of the DATX8 PLL lock pin.

Write Leveling Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the write leveling LCDL during calibration. The measured period is used to generate the control of the write leveling pipeline which is a function of the write-leveling delay and the clock period. This value is PVT compensated.
Write Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is a write leveling error in the DATX8.
Write Leveling Done: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has completed write leveling.
Write Leveling Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write leveling slave delay line.
Read DQS gating Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating LCDL.
Read DQS# Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS# LCDL.
Read DQS Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS LCDL.
Write DQ Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write DQ LCDL.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Delay Line Test Code: Returns the code measured by the PHY control block that corresponds to the period of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Delay Line Test Done: Indicates, if set, that the PHY control block has finished doing period measurement of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Read DQS gating Status Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating status LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
Read DQS Gating Status Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating status LCDL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the static read training. Static read training not supported in this release.

Write DQS2DQ training error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write DQS2DQ training Each 2 bits indicate error on one rank. (e.g. bits [13:12] shows error on rank 0) Status encoding are:

Error Status: If an error occurred for this lane as indicated by RDERR, WDERR, REERR or WEERR the error status code can provide additional information regard when the error occurred during the algorithm execution.
Write Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write eye centering training.
Write Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read eye centering training.
Write Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Write Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

VREF Training Error Status Code: Indicates which phase of error check failed. Valid status encodings are: ESTAT[0] = Init vref check failed. ESTAT[1] = Final check for DRAM VREF failed ESTAT[2] = Final check for Host VREF failed.
DRAM VREF Training Warning: Indicates if set that there an warning in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
DRAM VREF Training Error: Indicates if set that there an error in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Host VREF Training Warning: Indicates if set that there an warning in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Host VREF Training Error: Indicates if set that there an error in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Delay Pass Count: This read only field provides information regarding the trained RDDLY value in DDRPHY_DXnGCR0[23:20]. Valid status encodings are:

Calibration Bypass: Prevents, if set, period measurement calibration from automatically triggering after PHY initialization.

Master Delay Line Enable: Enables, if set, the DATX8 master delay line calibration to perform subsequent period measurements following the initial period measurements that are performed after reset or on when calibration is manually triggered. These additional measurements are accumulated and filtered as long as this bit remains high. This bit is combined with the common DATX8 MDL enable bit.
Configurable ODT(TE) phase shift applicable only when DDRPHY_DX8SLnDXCTL2[CRDEN] = 1'b1.
DQS Duty Cycle Correction
Number of Cycles (in terms of ctl_rd_clk) to generate ctl_dx_get_static_rd input for the respective byte lane of the PHY. Valid only when RDMODE is set as static response mode.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQSNSE Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQSN gate. This bit controls the PDRSE pin on the PDQS cell.
DQSSE Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQS gate. This bit controls the PDRSE pin on the PDQS cell.
RTT On Additive Latency: Indicates when the ODT control of DQ/DQS SSTL I/Os is set to the value in DQODT/DQSODT during read cycles. Valid values are:

RTT Output Hold: Indicates the number of clock cycles, which range from 2 - 5, after the read data postamble for which ODT control should remain set to DQSODT for DQS or DQODT for DQ/DM before disabling it (setting it to ‘0’) when using dynamic ODT control. ODT is disabled almost RTTOH clock cycles after the read postamble.
Configurable PDR phase shift. applicable only when DDRPHY_DX8SLnDXCTL2[CRDEN] = 1'b1.
DQSG Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQS gate.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQSG On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination (TE pin) on the I/O for DQS gate. Note that in typical usage, DQSGOE will always be on, rendering this control bit meaningless.
DQSG Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver (OE pin) on the I/O for DQS gate.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Enables the PDR mode values for DQ[7:0]. The bit [1:0] is for DQ[0], bit[3:2] for DQ[1] etc. Valid values are:
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Selects the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe #
Selects the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe
Output Enable Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O output enable (D) slice
I/O Power-Down Receiver Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O power-down receiver (D) slice.
I/O Terminate Enable Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O terminate enable (D) slice.

Data Strobe, Data Strobe # , Read Data Valid, Read Data Strobe , Read Data Strobe Gate , Control Clock Gate and Clock Generator Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the corresponding block. Read Data Strobe, Read Data Strobe#, Read Data Strobe gate Enable: Enables, when set to 1

Data Mask Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clock to all registers inside a correspondingly numbered data output (D) slice. Read Data Mask Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clock to all registers inside a correspondingly numbered read data input (Q) slice. Read Data Mask Enable: Enables, if set to 1, the read data path.
Enables DQ corresponding to each bit in a byte

Read Data BDL VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the read data bit delay lines.
Write Data BDL VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the write data bit delay lines.

Read DQS LCDL Delay VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the read DQS LCDL.
Write DQ LCDL Delay VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the write DQ LCDL.
Write Leveling LCDL Delay VT Compensation: Enables, if set, the VT drift compensation of the write leveling LCDL.
Read DQS Gating Status LCDL Delay VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the read DQS gating status LCDL.
Power Down Receiver BDL VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the power down receiver bit delay line.

Enables the TE mode values for DQS. Valid values are:

Byte lane VREF IOM (Used only by D4MU IOs)
Byte Lane VREF Pad Enable: Enables the pass gate between (to connect) VREF and PAD.
Byte Lane External VREF Enable: Enables the generation of VREF value for external byte lane differential IO buffers.

Byte Lane Single-End VREF Enable: Enables the generation of VREF value for internal byte lane single-end IO buffers. This is for DQSG loopback read gating path which is single ended. The Vref value is defined in DDRPHY_DXnGCR4[DXREFSSEL].

DDL Calibration Type: Select the algorithm in DDL Calibration. Select the algorithm as follows:
DDL Calibration Starting Value: Initial LCDL delay select value in DDL Calibration.
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 8).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQ bit 4 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 3 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 2 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 1 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description

DQ bit 0 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[0] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ0MAP to 0x5 will configure DQ[0] for this byte lane to be routed to the 6th DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 9).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DM bit DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 7 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 6 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description

DQ bit 5 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[5] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ6MAP to 0x2 will configure DQ[5] for this byte lane to be routed to the 2nd DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).

Write Latency Adjustment error: Indicates, for each of the system ranks, that an error occurred in the WLA algorithm. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Write Leveling DQ Status: Captures the write leveling DQ status from the DRAM during software write leveling.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Read DQS gating Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
DATX8 PLL Lock: Indicates, if set, that DATX8 PLL has locked. This is a direct status of the DATX8 PLL lock pin.

Write Leveling Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the write leveling LCDL during calibration. The measured period is used to generate the control of the write leveling pipeline which is a function of the write-leveling delay and the clock period. This value is PVT compensated.
Write Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is a write leveling error in the DATX8.
Write Leveling Done: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has completed write leveling.
Write Leveling Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write leveling slave delay line.
Read DQS gating Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating LCDL.
Read DQS# Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS# LCDL.
Read DQS Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS LCDL.
Write DQ Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write DQ LCDL.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Delay Line Test Code: Returns the code measured by the PHY control block that corresponds to the period of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Delay Line Test Done: Indicates, if set, that the PHY control block has finished doing period measurement of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Read DQS gating Status Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating status LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
Read DQS Gating Status Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating status LCDL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the static read training. Static read training not supported in this release.

Write DQS2DQ training error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write DQS2DQ training Each 2 bits indicate error on one rank. (e.g. bits [13:12] shows error on rank 0) Status encoding are:

Error Status: If an error occurred for this lane as indicated by RDERR, WDERR, REERR or WEERR the error status code can provide additional information regard when the error occurred during the algorithm execution.
Write Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write eye centering training.
Write Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read eye centering training.
Write Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Write Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Calibration Bypass: Prevents, if set, period measurement calibration from automatically triggering after PHY initialization.

Master Delay Line Enable: Enables, if set, the DATX8 master delay line calibration to perform subsequent period measurements following the initial period measurements that are performed after reset or on when calibration is manually triggered. These additional measurements are accumulated and filtered as long as this bit remains high. This bit is combined with the common DATX8 MDL enable bit.
Configurable ODT(TE) phase shift applicable only when DDRPHY_DX8SLnDXCTL2[CRDEN] = 1'b1.
DQS Duty Cycle Correction
Number of Cycles (in terms of ctl_rd_clk) to generate ctl_dx_get_static_rd input for the respective byte lane of the PHY. Valid only when RDMODE is set as static response mode.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQSNSE Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQSN gate. This bit controls the PDRSE pin on the PDQS cell.
DQSSE Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQS gate. This bit controls the PDRSE pin on the PDQS cell.
RTT On Additive Latency: Indicates when the ODT control of DQ/DQS SSTL I/Os is set to the value in DQODT/DQSODT during read cycles. Valid values are:

RTT Output Hold: Indicates the number of clock cycles, which range from 2 - 5, after the read data postamble for which ODT control should remain set to DQSODT for DQS or DQODT for DQ/DM before disabling it (setting it to ‘0’) when using dynamic ODT control. ODT is disabled almost RTTOH clock cycles after the read postamble.
Configurable PDR phase shift. applicable only when DDRPHY_DX8SLnDXCTL2[CRDEN] = 1'b1.
DQSG Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQS gate.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQSG On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination (TE pin) on the I/O for DQS gate. Note that in typical usage, DQSGOE will always be on, rendering this control bit meaningless.
DQSG Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver (OE pin) on the I/O for DQS gate.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Enables the PDR mode values for DQ[7:0]. The bit [1:0] is for DQ[0], bit[3:2] for DQ[1] etc. Valid values are:

Selects the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe #
Selects the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe
Output Enable Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O output enable (D) slice
I/O Power-Down Receiver Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O power-down receiver (D) slice.
I/O Terminate Enable Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O terminate enable (D) slice.

Data Strobe, Data Strobe # , Read Data Valid, Read Data Strobe , Read Data Strobe Gate , Control Clock Gate and Clock Generator Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the corresponding block. Read Data Strobe, Read Data Strobe#, Read Data Strobe gate Enable: Enables, when set to 1

Data Mask Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clock to all registers inside a correspondingly numbered data output (D) slice. Read Data Mask Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clock to all registers inside a correspondingly numbered read data input (Q) slice. Read Data Mask Enable: Enables, if set to 1, the read data path.
Enables DQ corresponding to each bit in a byte

Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 8).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQ bit 4 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 3 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 2 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 1 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description

DQ bit 0 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[0] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ0MAP to 0x5 will configure DQ[0] for this byte lane to be routed to the 6th DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 9).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DM bit DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 7 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 6 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description

DQ bit 5 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[5] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ6MAP to 0x2 will configure DQ[5] for this byte lane to be routed to the 2nd DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).

DQ write path latency pipeline: Write data is pipelined by (WLSL + WDQSL). Total write data pipeline is: [Write leveling system latency] + WDQSL/2 DRAM clock periods This value is adjusted by LPDDR4 tDQS2DQ training and write eye centering. Any update in DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] will update this field after 20 DDRSS_PHY_CTL_CLK clock cycles. Reading this field shows the number of pipelines (UI delays) written into DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] field. Make sure content of this register field is not overwritten by the software.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Write Leveling System Latency: Used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. This field is for the byte when in x8 mode Valid values:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 0x00 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). Valid values are 0 to 18 and each increment adds a half SDRAM CK period.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Calibration Bypass: Prevents, if set, period measurement calibration from automatically triggering after PHY initialization.

Master Delay Line Enable: Enables, if set, the DATX8 master delay line calibration to perform subsequent period measurements following the initial period measurements that are performed after reset or on when calibration is manually triggered. These additional measurements are accumulated and filtered as long as this bit remains high. This bit is combined with the common DATX8 MDL enable bit.
Configurable ODT(TE) phase shift applicable only when DDRPHY_DX8SLnDXCTL2[CRDEN] = 1'b1.
DQS Duty Cycle Correction
Number of Cycles (in terms of ctl_rd_clk) to generate ctl_dx_get_static_rd input for the respective byte lane of the PHY. Valid only when RDMODE is set as static response mode.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQSNSE Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQSN gate. This bit controls the PDRSE pin on the PDQS cell.
DQSSE Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQS gate. This bit controls the PDRSE pin on the PDQS cell.
RTT On Additive Latency: Indicates when the ODT control of DQ/DQS SSTL I/Os is set to the value in DQODT/DQSODT during read cycles. Valid values are:

RTT Output Hold: Indicates the number of clock cycles, which range from 2 - 5, after the read data postamble for which ODT control should remain set to DQSODT for DQS or DQODT for DQ/DM before disabling it (setting it to ‘0’) when using dynamic ODT control. ODT is disabled almost RTTOH clock cycles after the read postamble.
Configurable PDR phase shift. applicable only when DDRPHY_DX8SLnDXCTL2[CRDEN] = 1'b1.
DQSG Power Down Receiver: Powers down, if set, the input receiver on the I/O for DQS gate.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQSG On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination (TE pin) on the I/O for DQS gate. Note that in typical usage, DQSGOE will always be on, rendering this control bit meaningless.
DQSG Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver (OE pin) on the I/O for DQS gate.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Enables the PDR mode values for DQ[7:0]. The bit [1:0] is for DQ[0], bit[3:2] for DQ[1] etc. Valid values are:
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Selects the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe #
Selects the delayed or non-delayed read data strobe
Output Enable Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O output enable (D) slice
I/O Power-Down Receiver Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O power-down receiver (D) slice.
I/O Terminate Enable Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the I/O terminate enable (D) slice.

Data Strobe, Data Strobe # , Read Data Valid, Read Data Strobe , Read Data Strobe Gate , Control Clock Gate and Clock Generator Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clocks to all registers inside the corresponding block. Read Data Strobe, Read Data Strobe#, Read Data Strobe gate Enable: Enables, when set to 1

Data Mask Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clock to all registers inside a correspondingly numbered data output (D) slice. Read Data Mask Clock Gate: When set to 0, this signal will gate (stop) the clock to all registers inside a correspondingly numbered read data input (Q) slice. Read Data Mask Enable: Enables, if set to 1, the read data path.
Enables DQ corresponding to each bit in a byte

Byte lane VREF IOM (Used only by D4MU IOs)
Byte Lane VREF Pad Enable: Enables the pass gate between (to connect) VREF and PAD.
Byte Lane External VREF Enable: Enables the generation of VREF value for external byte lane differential IO buffers.

Byte Lane Single-End VREF Enable: Enables the generation of VREF value for internal byte lane single-end IO buffers. This is for DQSG loopback read gating path which is single ended. The Vref value is defined in DDRPHY_DXnGCR4[DXREFSSEL].
Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.
External VREF generator REFSEL range select
Byte Lane External VREF Select: Selects the generated VREF value for external byte lane I/Os.
Selects generated MVREFSE range used for PDQS IO (read DQS gate)
Selects reference value for single ended comparator in PDQS IO (read DQS gate).
Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.
VREF Enable control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane. This applies to DQ and DM I/Os
VRMON control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane.

DDL Calibration Type: Select the algorithm in DDL Calibration. Select the algorithm as follows:
DDL Calibration Starting Value: Initial LCDL delay select value in DDL Calibration.
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 8).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQ bit 4 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 3 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 2 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 1 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description

DQ bit 0 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[0] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ0MAP to 0x5 will configure DQ[0] for this byte lane to be routed to the 6th DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 9).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DM bit DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 7 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 6 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description

DQ bit 5 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[5] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ6MAP to 0x2 will configure DQ[5] for this byte lane to be routed to the 2nd DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).

Target Period: Target period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This is the current measured value of the period and is continuously updated if the MDL is enabled to do so.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Initial Period: Initial period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This value is used as the denominator when calculating the ratios of updates during VT compensation.

register.description: DATX8 n Master Delay Line Register 1

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
MDL Delay: Delay select for the LCDL for the Master Delay Line.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQ write path latency pipeline: Write data is pipelined by (WLSL + WDQSL). Total write data pipeline is: [Write leveling system latency] + WDQSL/2 DRAM clock periods This value is adjusted by LPDDR4 tDQS2DQ training and write eye centering. Any update in DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] will update this field after 20 DDRSS_PHY_CTL_CLK clock cycles. Reading this field shows the number of pipelines (UI delays) written into DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] field. Make sure content of this register field is not overwritten by the software.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Write Leveling System Latency: Used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. This field is for the byte when in x8 mode Valid values:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 0x00 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). Valid values are 0 to 18 and each increment adds a half SDRAM CK period.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQS Gate Training Error: Indicates if set that there is an error in DQS gate training of the byte in x8 mode One bit for each of the up to 16 ranks.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Read Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is an error in read leveling training of the byte in x8 mode One bit for each of the up to 16 ranks.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Write Latency Adjustment “DQS off on some DQ lines” warning. One bit per rank indicates that, for that rank, the WLA algorithm found some DQ lines where the read data sequence did not match the expected comparison signatures. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Write Latency Adjustment error: Indicates, for each of the system ranks, that an error occurred in the WLA algorithm. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Write Leveling DQ Status: Captures the write leveling DQ status from the DRAM during software write leveling.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Read DQS gating Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
DATX8 PLL Lock: Indicates, if set, that DATX8 PLL has locked. This is a direct status of the DATX8 PLL lock pin.

Write Leveling Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the write leveling LCDL during calibration. The measured period is used to generate the control of the write leveling pipeline which is a function of the write-leveling delay and the clock period. This value is PVT compensated.
Write Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is a write leveling error in the DATX8.
Write Leveling Done: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has completed write leveling.
Write Leveling Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write leveling slave delay line.
Read DQS gating Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating LCDL.
Read DQS# Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS# LCDL.
Read DQS Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS LCDL.
Write DQ Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write DQ LCDL.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Delay Line Test Code: Returns the code measured by the PHY control block that corresponds to the period of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Delay Line Test Done: Indicates, if set, that the PHY control block has finished doing period measurement of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Read DQS gating Status Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating status LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
Read DQS Gating Status Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating status LCDL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the static read training. Static read training not supported in this release.

Write DQS2DQ training error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write DQS2DQ training Each 2 bits indicate error on one rank. (e.g. bits [13:12] shows error on rank 0) Status encoding are:

Error Status: If an error occurred for this lane as indicated by RDERR, WDERR, REERR or WEERR the error status code can provide additional information regard when the error occurred during the algorithm execution.
Write Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write eye centering training.
Write Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read eye centering training.
Write Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Write Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

VREF Training Error Status Code: Indicates which phase of error check failed. Valid status encodings are: ESTAT[0] = Init vref check failed. ESTAT[1] = Final check for DRAM VREF failed ESTAT[2] = Final check for Host VREF failed.
DRAM VREF Training Warning: Indicates if set that there an warning in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
DRAM VREF Training Error: Indicates if set that there an error in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Host VREF Training Warning: Indicates if set that there an warning in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Host VREF Training Error: Indicates if set that there an error in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Delay Pass Count: This read only field provides information regarding the trained RDDLY value in DDRPHY_DXnGCR0[23:20]. Valid status encodings are:

Read Data Mask BDL VT Compensation: Enables, if set the VT drift compensation of the read data mask bit delay lines.

Byte lane VREF IOM (Used only by D4MU IOs)

Byte Lane External VREF Enable: Enables the generation of VREF value for external byte lane differential IO buffers.

Byte Lane Single-End VREF Enable: Enables the generation of VREF value for internal byte lane single-end IO buffers. This is for DQSG loopback read gating path which is single ended. The Vref value is defined in DDRPHY_DXnGCR4[DXREFSSEL].
Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.
External VREF generator REFSEL range select
Byte Lane External VREF Select: Selects the generated VREF value for external byte lane I/Os.
Selects generated MVREFSE range used for PDQS IO (read DQS gate)
Selects reference value for single ended comparator in PDQS IO (read DQS gate).
Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.
VREF Enable control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane. This applies to DQ and DM I/Os
VRMON control for DQ IO (Single Ended) buffers of a byte lane.
Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.
Rank3: Select value of internally generated Vref for PDDRIO

Rank1: Select value of internally generated Vref for PDDRIO

Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.

Reserved.Returns zeros on reads.

DDL Calibration Type: Select the algorithm in DDL Calibration. Select the algorithm as follows:
DDL Calibration Starting Value: Initial LCDL delay select value in DDL Calibration.
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 8).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQ bit 4 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 3 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 2 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description
DQ bit 1 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ0MAP description

DQ bit 0 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[0] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ0MAP to 0x5 will configure DQ[0] for this byte lane to be routed to the 6th DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).
Checksum bit. MAPOK is set to '1' if and only if all DQxMAP fields in DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP0 and DDRPHY_DXnDQMAP1 are uniquely set to values in the correct range (0 to 9).
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DM bit DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 7 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description
DQ bit 6 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. See DQ5MAP description

DQ bit 5 DATX8 slice mapping index. Value range of 0 to 8. The programmed value defines the DATX8 DQ/DM slice order that the byte lane DQ[5] bit is mapped to; for example, setting DQ6MAP to 0x2 will configure DQ[5] for this byte lane to be routed to the 2nd DATX8 DQ slice counted from the bottom (or from the left in vertical slice implementations).

Target Period: Target period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This is the current measured value of the period and is continuously updated if the MDL is enabled to do so.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Initial Period: Initial period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This value is used as the denominator when calculating the ratios of updates during VT compensation.

register.description: DATX8 n Master Delay Line Register 1

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
MDL Delay: Delay select for the LCDL for the Master Delay Line.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQ write path latency pipeline: Write data is pipelined by (WLSL + WDQSL). Total write data pipeline is: [Write leveling system latency] + WDQSL/2 DRAM clock periods This value is adjusted by LPDDR4 tDQS2DQ training and write eye centering. Any update in DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] will update this field after 20 DDRSS_PHY_CTL_CLK clock cycles. Reading this field shows the number of pipelines (UI delays) written into DDRPHY_DXnLCDLR1[WDQD] field. Make sure content of this register field is not overwritten by the software.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Write Leveling System Latency: Used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. This field is for the byte when in x8 mode Valid values:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 0x00 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). Valid values are 0 to 18 and each increment adds a half SDRAM CK period.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DQS Gate Training Error: Indicates if set that there is an error in DQS gate training of the byte in x8 mode One bit for each of the up to 16 ranks.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Read Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is an error in read leveling training of the byte in x8 mode One bit for each of the up to 16 ranks.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Write Latency Adjustment “DQS off on some DQ lines” warning. One bit per rank indicates that, for that rank, the WLA algorithm found some DQ lines where the read data sequence did not match the expected comparison signatures. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Write Latency Adjustment error: Indicates, for each of the system ranks, that an error occurred in the WLA algorithm. This is for the byte in x8 mode
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Write Leveling DQ Status: Captures the write leveling DQ status from the DRAM during software write leveling.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Read DQS gating Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
DATX8 PLL Lock: Indicates, if set, that DATX8 PLL has locked. This is a direct status of the DATX8 PLL lock pin.

Write Leveling Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the write leveling LCDL during calibration. The measured period is used to generate the control of the write leveling pipeline which is a function of the write-leveling delay and the clock period. This value is PVT compensated.
Write Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is a write leveling error in the DATX8.
Write Leveling Done: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has completed write leveling.
Write Leveling Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write leveling slave delay line.
Read DQS gating Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating LCDL.
Read DQS# Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS# LCDL.
Read DQS Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS LCDL.
Write DQ Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write DQ LCDL.
Reserved.Returns zeroes on reads.
Delay Line Test Code: Returns the code measured by the PHY control block that corresponds to the period of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Delay Line Test Done: Indicates, if set, that the PHY control block has finished doing period measurement of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
Read DQS gating Status Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating status LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
Read DQS Gating Status Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating status LCDL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the static read training. Static read training not supported in this release.

Write DQS2DQ training error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write DQS2DQ training Each 2 bits indicate error on one rank. (e.g. bits [13:12] shows error on rank 0) Status encoding are:

Error Status: If an error occurred for this lane as indicated by RDERR, WDERR, REERR or WEERR the error status code can provide additional information regard when the error occurred during the algorithm execution.
Write Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write eye centering training.
Write Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read eye centering training.
Read Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read eye centering training.
Write Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Write Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Read Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read bit deskew training.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

VREF Training Error Status Code: Indicates which phase of error check failed. Valid status encodings are: ESTAT[0] = Init vref check failed. ESTAT[1] = Final check for DRAM VREF failed ESTAT[2] = Final check for Host VREF failed.
DRAM VREF Training Warning: Indicates if set that there an warning in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
DRAM VREF Training Error: Indicates if set that there an error in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Host VREF Training Warning: Indicates if set that there an warning in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Host VREF Training Error: Indicates if set that there an error in VREF was Training. Each bit indicates error for one rank.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Static Read Delay Pass Count: This read only field provides information regarding the trained RDDLY value in DDRPHY_DXnGCR0[23:20]. Valid status encodings are:

register.description: DATX8 0-1 Oscillator, Delay Line Test, PHY FIFO and High Speed Reset, Loopback, and Gated Clock Control Register

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Enable Clock Gating for DX ctl_rd_clk: Enables, when set, clock gating for power saving. Valid values are: Valid values are:
Enable Clock Gating for DX DDRSS_BYP_4X_CLK: Enables, when set, clock gating for power saving. Valid values are:
Enable Clock Gating for DX DDRSS_PHY_CTL_CLK: Enables, when set, clock gating for power saving. Valid values are:
Selects the level to which clocks will be stalled when clock gating is enabled in PHY. Valid values are:
Loopback Mode: Indicates, if set, that the PHY/PUB is in loopback mode.

Load GSDQS LCDL with 2x the calibrated GSDQSPRD value (equivalent to one CK period). This bit must only be used when initializing the GSDQS 180 degree offset for IO assisted gating mode. This bit is self clearing.
Loopback DQS Gating: Selects the DQS gating mode that should be used when the PHY is in loopback mode, including BIST loopback mode. Valid values are:
Loopback DQS Shift: Selects how the read DQS is shifted during loopback to ensure that the read DQS is centered into the read data eye. Valid values are:
PHY High-Speed Reset: A write of 1b0 to this bit resets the DATX8 macros without resetting PUB logic. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b1 must be written to de-assert the reset.
PHY FIFO Reset: A write of 1b0 to this bit resets the DATX8 FIFOs without resetting PUB logic. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b1 must be written to de-assert the reset.

Delay Line Test Start: A write of 1b1 to this bit will trigger delay line oscillator mode period measurement. This bit is not self clearing and needs to be reset to 1b0 before the measurement can be re-triggered.
Delay Line Test Mode: Selects, if set, the delay line oscillator test mode.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.

Oscillator Mode Write-Data Delay Line Select: Selects which of the two write data (WDQ) LCDLs is active. The delay select value of the inactive LCDL is set to zero while the delay select value of the active LCDL can be varied by the input write leveling delay select pin. Valid values are:
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.

Oscillator Mode Write-Leveling Delay Line Select: Selects which of the two write leveling LCDLs is active. The delay select value of the inactive LCDL is set to zero while the delay select value of the active LCDL can be varied by the input write leveling delay select pin. Valid values are:
Oscillator Mode Division: Specifies the factor by which the delay line oscillator mode output is divided down before it is output on the delay line digital test output pin dl_dto. Valid values are:
Oscillator Enable: Enables, if set, the delay line oscillation.
PLL Bypass: Bypasses the PLL if set to 1b1.
PLL Reset: Resets the PLLs by driving the PLL reset pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b0 must be written to de-assert the reset.
PLL Power Down: Puts the PLLs in power down mode by driving the PLL power down pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b0 must be written to de-assert the power-down.
Reference Stop Mode. Connects to pin REF_STOP_MODE. Valid values are:
PLL Frequency Select: Selects the operating range of the PLL. Settings are specific to PLL type.
Relock Mode: Enables, if set, rapid relocking mode.
Charge Pump Proportional Current Control. Connects to pin CPPROP_CTRL on the PLL. Valid values are:
Charge Pump Integrating Current Control. Connects to pin CP_INT_CTRL on the PLL. Valid values are:
Gear Shift: Enables, if set, rapid locking mode. Connects to pin GEAR_SHIFT on the PLL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Analog Test Enable (ATOEN): Selects the analog test signal that should be driven on the analog test output pin. Otherwise the analog test output is tri-stated. This allows analog test output pins from multiple PLLs to be connected together. Valid values are:
Analog Test Control: Controls PLL input pins pll_ana_test_sel[3:0]. Selects various PLL analog test signals to be brought out via PLL analog test output pin (pll_ato).

Digital Test Control: Controls PLL input pins pll_dig_test_sel. Selects various PLL digital test signals and other test mode signals to be brought out via bit [1] of the PLL digital test output (pll_dto[1]).

Connects to the PLL PLL_PROG bus.
Bypass PLL vreg_cp
Bypass PLL vreg_dig.
Lock Detector Phase Select. Connects to pin LOCK_PHASE_SEL on the PLL.
Lock Detector Counter Select. Connects to pin LOCK_COUNT_SEL on the PLL.
Lock Detector Select. Connects to pin LOCK_DET_SEL on the PLL on the PLL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 2 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Connects to bits [31:0] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 3 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Connects to bits [63:32] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 4 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Connects to bits [95:64] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 5 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Connects to bits [103:96] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Read Path Rise-to-Rise Mode: Indicates if set that the PHY mission mode is configured to run in rise-to-rise mode for the read path. Otherwise, if not set, the PHY mission mode for the read path is running in rise-to-fall mode.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Write Path Rise-to-Rise Mode: Indicates if set that the PHY mission mode is configured to run in rise-to-rise mode for the write path. Otherwise, if not set, the PHY mission mode for the write path is running in rise-to-fall mode.

DQS Gate Extension: Specifies if set that the read DQS gate will be extended. This should be set ONLY when used with DQS pull-down and DQSn pull-up (DDRPHY_DX8SLnDQSCTL[DQSRES]&gt;0000 and DDRPHY_DX8SLnDQSCTL[DQSNRES]&gt;0000) and only in systems with no DQS termination or mid-rail DQS termination. Valid values are:

Low Power PLL Power Down: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to the DFI low power opportunity request and power down the PLL of the byte if the wakeup time request satisfies the LPWAKEUP_THRSH. LPWAKEUP_THRSH is the Minimum threshold value of tlp_wakeup required to make phy go into low power mode by powering down PLL. The value of the dfi_lp_wakeup signal at the time that the dfi_lp_data_req &amp; dfi_lp_ctrl_req signal is de-asserted sets the tlp_wakeup time. The value is in tems of number clock cycles.
Low Power I/O Power Down: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to the DFI low power opportunity request and power down the I/Os of the byte.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Set PDA mode timing. If this bit is set by the MCTL, the DFI write commands are delayed by 2 SDRAM clock cycles, while at the same time the DQ data will be advanced with respect to the DQS. This allows the MCTL to satisfy the t_PDA_S timing requirement. This register field must be set in conjunction with DDRPHY_PGCR4[18] for PDA mode to be properly enabled/disabled.
QS Counter Enable. Enables, if set, the counting of DQS edges for automatic shut-off of DQS gate. If turned off, the gate is closed using the gate signal from the PUB.
Unused DQ I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 1b0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1b1) of the I/O for unused DQ pins.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Data Slew Rate: Selects slew rate of the I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros.
DQS# Resistor: DQS_c glitch suppression resistor controls
DQS Resistor: DQS_t glitch suppression resistor controls
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Delay Load Timing: Specifies the timing of the signal that is used to load the new delay select values into the LCDL when switching between ranks that have different delays. Valid values are:

DX DDL Load Type: Specifies how a new delay select value is applied to the delay line. This is only applicable to DDLs that have their delay select signals pipelined, such write leveling LCDL and read DQS gating LCDL. Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DATX8 DDL Delay Select Dynamic Load: Specifies whether the registers inside the DATX8 that hold the delay select signal of DATX8 DDL should be dynamically loaded only when the delay select changes or should be continuously (always) loaded. Valid values are:
DATX8 DDL Bypass: Specifies, if set to 1b1 that the DDL delay should be bypassed. Otherwise the DDL bypass is turned off. Different bits control different DATX8 DDLs as follows:
Controls DDL Bypass Mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DATX Calibration Clock Select: Valid values are:
DATX8 read Clock Mode: Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DATX8 Digital Test Output Select: This is used to select the DATX8 internal signals that should be driven on the two DATX8 digital test outputs (phy_status[3:2]) signals. Valid values for DATX8 digital test output bit 0 (phy_status[2]) are:Valid values for digital test out bit 1[1] (phy_status[3]) are:

Read DQS gating status mode: Indicates if set that the read DQS gating status that is stored in the DQS read FIFO is the gate input. Otherwise, if not set, the registered DQS gate status is stores in the FIFO
Read DQS/DQS# delay load bypass mode. Valid values are:
Read DQS gate delay load bypass mode. Valid values are:
DATX8 Test Mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Configurable Read Data Enable:
OE extension during post-amble
OE extension during pre-amble
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
I/O-assisted Gate Select (experimental read gate mode)
DATX8 I/O Loop-Back Select: Selects where inside the I/O the loop-back of signals happens. Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Low Power Wakeup Threshold: If dfi_lp_wakeup is greater than this threshold value, PLLs will be powered down when entering DFI low power mode. The value of the dfi_lp_wakeup signal at the time that the dfi_lp_ctrl_req or dfi_lp_data_req signal is asserted sets the tlp_wakeup time. Valid values in tems of number clock cycles are:

Read Data Bus Inversion Enable: when set to 1b1 (and MR5[12] is set to 1b11b1 in DDR4 mode and MR3[6] is set to 1'b1 in LPDDR4 mode). PUB performs data bus inversion on the DRAM read data; when set to 1b0, the read data and DM_n/DBI_n signal are passed on to the controller as is.

Write Data Bus Inversion Enable: when set to 1b1 (and MR5[11:10] is set to 2b10 in DDR4 and MR3[7] is set to 1'b1 in LPDDR4 mode), PUB generates the write DBI on the DM_n/DBI_n signal. Not supported with write CRC.
Pub Read FIFO Bypass: When set to 1b1, the read capture FIFO inside PUB is bypassed. Valid values are:
DATX8 Receive FIFO Read Mode. Valid values are:
Disables the Read FIFO reset: When set, read receive fifo can’t be reset from ctl_dx_rdfifo_rstn input. Valid values are:

register.description: DATX8 0-1 Oscillator, Delay Line Test, PHY FIFO and High Speed Reset, Loopback, and Gated Clock Control Register

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Enable Clock Gating for DX ctl_rd_clk: Enables, when set, clock gating for power saving. Valid values are: Valid values are:
Enable Clock Gating for DX DDRSS_BYP_4X_CLK: Enables, when set, clock gating for power saving. Valid values are:
Enable Clock Gating for DX DDRSS_PHY_CTL_CLK: Enables, when set, clock gating for power saving. Valid values are:
Selects the level to which clocks will be stalled when clock gating is enabled in PHY. Valid values are:
Loopback Mode: Indicates, if set, that the PHY/PUB is in loopback mode.

Load GSDQS LCDL with 2x the calibrated GSDQSPRD value (equivalent to one CK period). This bit must only be used when initializing the GSDQS 180 degree offset for IO assisted gating mode. This bit is self clearing.
Loopback DQS Gating: Selects the DQS gating mode that should be used when the PHY is in loopback mode, including BIST loopback mode. Valid values are:
Loopback DQS Shift: Selects how the read DQS is shifted during loopback to ensure that the read DQS is centered into the read data eye. Valid values are:
PHY High-Speed Reset: A write of 1b0 to this bit resets the DATX8 macros without resetting PUB logic. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b1 must be written to de-assert the reset.
PHY FIFO Reset: A write of 1b0 to this bit resets the DATX8 FIFOs without resetting PUB logic. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b1 must be written to de-assert the reset.

Delay Line Test Start: A write of 1b1 to this bit will trigger delay line oscillator mode period measurement. This bit is not self clearing and needs to be reset to 1b0 before the measurement can be re-triggered.
Delay Line Test Mode: Selects, if set, the delay line oscillator test mode.
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.

Oscillator Mode Write-Data Delay Line Select: Selects which of the two write data (WDQ) LCDLs is active. The delay select value of the inactive LCDL is set to zero while the delay select value of the active LCDL can be varied by the input write leveling delay select pin. Valid values are:
Reserved.Caution, do not write to this register field.

Oscillator Mode Write-Leveling Delay Line Select: Selects which of the two write leveling LCDLs is active. The delay select value of the inactive LCDL is set to zero while the delay select value of the active LCDL can be varied by the input write leveling delay select pin. Valid values are:
Oscillator Mode Division: Specifies the factor by which the delay line oscillator mode output is divided down before it is output on the delay line digital test output pin dl_dto. Valid values are:
Oscillator Enable: Enables, if set, the delay line oscillation.
PLL Bypass: Bypasses the PLL if set to 1b1.
PLL Reset: Resets the PLLs by driving the PLL reset pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b0 must be written to de-assert the reset.
PLL Power Down: Puts the PLLs in power down mode by driving the PLL power down pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a 1b0 must be written to de-assert the power-down.
Reference Stop Mode. Connects to pin REF_STOP_MODE. Valid values are:
PLL Frequency Select: Selects the operating range of the PLL. Settings are specific to PLL type.
Relock Mode: Enables, if set, rapid relocking mode.
Charge Pump Proportional Current Control. Connects to pin CPPROP_CTRL on the PLL. Valid values are:
Charge Pump Integrating Current Control. Connects to pin CP_INT_CTRL on the PLL. Valid values are:
Gear Shift: Enables, if set, rapid locking mode. Connects to pin GEAR_SHIFT on the PLL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Analog Test Enable (ATOEN): Selects the analog test signal that should be driven on the analog test output pin. Otherwise the analog test output is tri-stated. This allows analog test output pins from multiple PLLs to be connected together. Valid values are:
Analog Test Control: Controls PLL input pins pll_ana_test_sel[3:0]. Selects various PLL analog test signals to be brought out via PLL analog test output pin (pll_ato).

Digital Test Control: Controls PLL input pins pll_dig_test_sel. Selects various PLL digital test signals and other test mode signals to be brought out via bit [1] of the PLL digital test output (pll_dto[1]).

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 1 (Type B PLL Only)

Connects to the PLL PLL_PROG bus.

Bypass PLL vreg_dig.

Lock Detector Select. Connects to pin LOCK_DET_SEL on the PLL on the PLL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 2 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Connects to bits [31:0] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 3 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Connects to bits [63:32] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.

register.description: DAXT8 0-1 PLL Control Register 5 (Type B PLL Only)

bitfield.description: Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Connects to bits [103:96] of the PLL general control bus PLL_CTRL.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Read Path Rise-to-Rise Mode: Indicates if set that the PHY mission mode is configured to run in rise-to-rise mode for the read path. Otherwise, if not set, the PHY mission mode for the read path is running in rise-to-fall mode.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Write Path Rise-to-Rise Mode: Indicates if set that the PHY mission mode is configured to run in rise-to-rise mode for the write path. Otherwise, if not set, the PHY mission mode for the write path is running in rise-to-fall mode.

DQS Gate Extension: Specifies if set that the read DQS gate will be extended. This should be set ONLY when used with DQS pull-down and DQSn pull-up (DDRPHY_DX8SLnDQSCTL[DQSRES]&gt;0000 and DDRPHY_DX8SLnDQSCTL[DQSNRES]&gt;0000) and only in systems with no DQS termination or mid-rail DQS termination. Valid values are:

Low Power PLL Power Down: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to the DFI low power opportunity request and power down the PLL of the byte if the wakeup time request satisfies the LPWAKEUP_THRSH. LPWAKEUP_THRSH is the Minimum threshold value of tlp_wakeup required to make phy go into low power mode by powering down PLL. The value of the dfi_lp_wakeup signal at the time that the dfi_lp_data_req&amp;dfi_lp_ctrl_req signal is de-asserted sets the tlp_wakeup time. The value is in tems of number clock cycles.
Low Power I/O Power Down: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to the DFI low power opportunity request and power down the I/Os of the byte.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Set PDA mode timing. If this bit is set by the MCTL, the DFI write commands are delayed by 2 SDRAM clock cycles, while at the same time the DQ data will be advanced with respect to the DQS. This allows the MCTL to satisfy the t_PDA_S timing requirement. This register field must be set in conjunction with DDRPHY_PGCR4[18] for PDA mode to be properly enabled/disabled.
QS Counter Enable. Enables, if set, the counting of DQS edges for automatic shut-off of DQS gate. If turned off, the gate is closed using the gate signal from the PUB.
Unused DQ I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 1b0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1b1) of the I/O for unused DQ pins.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Data Slew Rate: Selects slew rate of the I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of all DATX8 macros.
DQS# Resistor: DQS_c glitch suppression resistor controls
DQS Resistor: DQS_t glitch suppression resistor controls
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Delay Load Timing: Specifies the timing of the signal that is used to load the new delay select values into the LCDL when switching between ranks that have different delays. Valid values are:

DX DDL Load Type: Specifies how a new delay select value is applied to the delay line. This is only applicable to DDLs that have their delay select signals pipelined, such write leveling LCDL and read DQS gating LCDL. Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DATX8 DDL Delay Select Dynamic Load: Specifies whether the registers inside the DATX8 that hold the delay select signal of DATX8 DDL should be dynamically loaded only when the delay select changes or should be continuously (always) loaded. Valid values are:
DATX8 DDL Bypass: Specifies, if set to 1b1 that the DDL delay should be bypassed. Otherwise the DDL bypass is turned off. Different bits control different DATX8 DDLs as follows:
Controls DDL Bypass Mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
DATX Calibration Clock Select: Valid values are:
DATX8 read Clock Mode: Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

DATX8 Digital Test Output Select: This is used to select the DATX8 internal signals that should be driven on the two DATX8 digital test outputs (phy_status[3:2]) signals. Valid values for DATX8 digital test output bit 0 (phy_status[2]) are:

Read DQS gating status mode: Indicates if set that the read DQS gating status that is stored in the DQS read FIFO is the gate input. Otherwise, if not set, the registered DQS gate status is stores in the FIFO
Read DQS/DQS# delay load bypass mode. Valid values are:
Read DQS gate delay load bypass mode. Valid values are:
DATX8 Test Mode
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Configurable Read Data Enable:
OE extension during post-amble
OE extension during pre-amble
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
I/O-assisted Gate Select (experimental read gate mode)
DATX8 I/O Loop-Back Select: Selects where inside the I/O the loop-back of signals happens. Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

Low Power Wakeup Threshold: If dfi_lp_wakeup is greater than this threshold value, PLLs will be powered down when entering DFI low power mode. The value of the dfi_lp_wakeup signal at the time that the dfi_lp_ctrl_req or dfi_lp_data_req signal is asserted sets the tlp_wakeup time. Valid values in tems of number clock cycles are:

Read Data Bus Inversion Enable: when set to 1b1 (and MR5[12] is set to 1b11b1 in DDR4 mode and MR3[6] is set to 1'b1 in LPDDR4 mode). PUB performs data bus inversion on the DRAM read data; when set to 1b0, the read data and DM_n/DBI_n signal are passed on to the controller as is.

Write Data Bus Inversion Enable: when set to 1b1 (and MR5[11:10] is set to 2b10 in DDR4 and MR3[7] is set to 1'b1 in LPDDR4 mode), PUB generates the write DBI on the DM_n/DBI_n signal. Not supported with write CRC.
Pub Read FIFO Bypass: When set to 1b1, the read capture FIFO inside PUB is bypassed. Valid values are:
DATX8 Receive FIFO Read Mode. Valid values are:
Disables the Read FIFO reset: When set, read receive fifo can’t be reset from ctl_dx_rdfifo_rstn input. Valid values are:

Read DQS Gate, DQS, DQS# I/O Loopback: Controls the loopback signal (LB) on the I/O that is used to drive the read DQS gate, DQS and DQS#. This also selects the type of gating used since it controls the signal driven on the DI output of this PDQSG I/O. Valid values are:
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.
Reserved.Return zeroes on reads.

IOM bits for PVREF, PVREF_DAC and PVREFE cells in DX IO ring
